fileheader.filedesc: Functions for interacting with a MySQL DBMS. You must have the MySQL headers and libraries installed. Only really tested with dynamically linking mysql libraries on Linux.

function.name: mysql_query
function.explain: Performs a query. Every occurrence of ? in the query will be replaced by corresponding parameter in the parameters array (if present). Parameters are automatically escaped. All parameters are handled as string by now.
Example: mysql_query(conn, "SELECT a FROM t WHERE a = ? AND b = ?", array{1,"hel'lo") executes "SELECT a FROM t WHERE a = '1' AND b = 'hel\'lo'"

function.name: mysql_affected_rows
function.explain: Returns number of rows affected by last query.

function.name: mysql_num_fields
function.explain: Returns number of fields in result.

function.name: mysql_num_rows
function.explain: Returns number of rows in result.

function.name: mysql_select_db
function.explain: Select a database to perform queries on.

function.name: mysql_field_name

parameter.name: column_index
parameter.value: index for the field in the result

function.explain: Returns the given field's name in result.
